transcript:
he was carried to the hospital. During this transfer he felt a little stronger and was able to look about him and even speak. 
The first words he heard on coming to his senses were those of a French convoy officer, who said rapidly: "We must halt here: the Em- peror will pass here immediately; it will please him to see these gentlemen prisoners." 
"There are so many prisoners today, nearly the whole Russian army, that he is probably tired of them," said another officer.
